item.title: For the 4th time in 5 months, detainees at St. Louis City’s...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

For the 4th time in 5 months, detainees at St. Louis City’s downtown jail have risen up.

Tonight they demanded to be allowed to have court dates, a reference to the long pretrial holds routine in the facility (and indeed very common in the country), only made worse by delays during the pandemic. According to data compiled by the public defender’s office, the average wait for a preliminary hearing for detainees in the City Justice Center in 2020 was 146 days.

Read our intervie...w with and EXPO St Louis organizer after the February 6 uprising here: https://www.liberationnews.org/interview-formerly-incarcer…/

And read about the protests about the conditions from the perspective of an incarcerated person here: https://www.liberationnews.org/letter-from-an-inmate-st-lo…/

See MoreExpo St. LouisSecond Uprising at the Criminal Justice Center in downtown St. Louis. Detainees are screaming that they want court dates!!Second Uprising at the Criminal Justice Center in downtown St. Louis. Detainees are screaming that they want court dates!!

item.title: Trump's racist border wall is now out of the news, but its...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Trump's racist border wall is now out of the news, but its impacts — especially on Indigenous people and the environment of the borderlands — are looming concerns that have yet to be resolved.

Read this article from Liberation News to learn more: https://www.liberationnews.org/what-happened-to-trumps-bor…/

item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverNational Committee for Justice in Denver

CALL TO ACTION 📢📢 Stand with targeted Denver protest leaders 👉 Upload a photo sharing why you demand DA's Brian Mason and John Kellner drop all charges now!

Her...e are the instructions:

1. Print the sign at bit.ly/ncjd-sign and write your message. (If you don’t have access to a printer, you can hand-print the prompt and hashtags.)

2. Take a photo of yourself holding the sign

3. Post it on social media and tag the National Committee for Justice in Denver and the prosecuting district attorneys along with the hashtag #DroptheChargesCO

Facebook tags for the DAs and the National Committee for Justice in Denver:
Brian Mason - @brianmason.us
John Kellner - @coda18

item.title: The trial has begun for Minneapolis cop Derek Chauvin, who...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

The trial has begun for Minneapolis cop Derek Chauvin, who murdered George Floyd in the spring of 2020. Earlier this week, the jury was shown the video of the murder, where Chauvin kneels on George Floyd’s kneel for over nine minutes until he stops breathing and dies. Chauvin’s defense attorneys stated in their opening arguments that the cop was only “doing what he had been trained to do” in his long career.

The judge in the case is already in some ways preventing or allowing... arguments that could lead to the exoneration of this killer cop. But as is shown in the video of Floyd's murder, the public recognized that Chauvin was a murderer from the second he dug his knee into George Floyd’s neck.

Listen to the latest episode of The Socialist Program with Brian Becker, discussing What Will Happen if Derek Chauvin Walks Free?

If Spotify isn't your platform, the podcast is available on all major streaming platforms.

https://open.spotify.com/episode/6KtudrceK1jOh2Zd3EFJ07…

See MoreListen to this episode from The Socialist Program with Brian Becker on Spotify. On today's "In the News" roundtable, Brian Becker, Nicole Roussell, Esther Iverem and Walter Smolarek discuss the trial of Derek Chauvin and other grotesque features of the American police state, protests across the coun...

item.title: Right now District Attorney John Kellner is holding a public...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Right now District Attorney John Kellner is holding a public event where he says he will address the community's questions. We encourage folks to ask, "Why are you continuing the prosecution of peaceful protesters?"

John Kellner is the new district attorney in Arapahoe County, where several historic peaceful marches and demonstrations for #JusticeforElijahMcClain took place last summer. Kellner's predecessor George Brauchler filed numerous felony and misdemeanor charges against the leaders of these peaceful demonstrations; now Kellner is continuing this prosecution. We call on John Kellner to do the right thing and end this miscarriage of justice which criminalizes the rightful and peaceful protest of his community in the face of deep racial injustice.

#DroptheChargesCO #JusticeforElijahMcClain

18th Judicial District Attorney's Office - Colorado was live.

Meet The DA

item.title: People in over 60 cities and towns across the United States took...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

People in over 60 cities and towns across the United States took to the streets last Saturday in a National Day of Action called by the Answer Coalition in solidarity with the Asian community in the midst of the horrific, racist and misogynist massacre that took place in Atlanta on March 16.

The protests called attention to the alarming rise in anti-Asian hate crimes over the past year, correlating to an increasingly hostile U.S. foreign policy towards China. The scapegoating of China for the COVID-19 pandemic and the intensifying preparations for war with the country, in the context of centuries of discrimination against Asian people, has driven the growth in violence.

In the face of this crisis, it is vital for people everywhere to come together to stand against racism and the dangerous propaganda of war.

+18
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverParty for Socialism and Liberation - PSLThe PSL is reflecting on months of hard work as voting...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverParty for Socialism and Liberation - PSL

The PSL is reflecting on months of hard work as voting ends for the historic union drive in Alabama. Serving as foot soldiers in the struggle, our organizers kn...ocked on thousands of doors to build community support for what could be the first US Amazon warehouse with a union. Amazon workers driving to the fulfillment center will see a sign supporting the union on every block.

This small industrial city has a long history of labor, civil rights, and radical struggle. Now at the forefront of the labor movement once again, Bessemer could be the spark that ignites a wave of similar drives around the country.

See MoreThis content isn't available right nowWhen this happens, it's usually because the owner only shared it with a small group of people, changed who can see it or it's been deleted.

item.title: An excellent article on the recent court ruling throwing out the...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

An excellent article on the recent court ruling throwing out the attempted kidnapping charges against peaceful protest leaders Joel Northam, Eliza Lucero, and Lillian House.

They still have many more false charges to defeat but this ruling was a powerful statement about the integrity of the case and a huge step forward for these unjustly targeted activists. #DroptheChargesCO

Judge Leroy Kirby ruled Thursday that there is no probable cause for the attempted first-degree kidnapping charges against three organizers arrested for a protest outside of Aurora Police headquarters in

gazette.com

Judge throws out attempted kidnapping charges against Aurora protest organizers

Judge Leroy Kirby ruled Thursday that there is no probable cause for the attempted first-degree kidnapping charges against three organizers arrested for a protest outside of Aurora Police headquarters inJudge Leroy Kirby ruled Thursday that there is no probable cause for the attempted first-degree kidnapping charges against three organizers arrested for a protest outside of Aurora Police headquarters in

item.title: "I was “too close” to the issues, too passionate, too...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

"I was “too close” to the issues, too passionate, too emotional, too aggressive. I was the most effective community journalist I had ever been, and I knew I was going to lose my job."

Lori Lizarraga was one of very few local journalists to give close and careful attention to the political prosecution of lead organizers of the protests for Elijah McClain. When well-known protest leaders, including PSL members, were arrested in September, she was in a small minority of media th...at did not simply regurgitate the police narrative. She took a closer look, interviewed Lillian and Joel directly, and put the real story on TV for Denver-area residents to see — the people most interested in knowing the truth about the police and prosecutors in their area.

The people of Denver need and deserve honest coverage and journalists who care enough and are brave enough to get it. Unfortunately, in many newsrooms, being the kind of journalist the community deserves is the kind of thing that gets you fired.

An important note — just as 9News was terminating Lori Lizarraga and other journalists, they brought on George Brauchler as their legal expert, one of the district attorneys who filed this outrageous political case against peaceful protest leaders.

https://www.westword.com/…/9news-latina-reporter-kusa-media…

See MoreI was one of three Latina reporters let go.

westword.com

LatinXed: 9News Got Rid of Three Latina Reporters This Past Year, Including Me

I was one of three Latina reporters let go.I was one of three Latina reporters let go.

item.title: “‘Today’s ruling is a very strong statement that the...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

“‘Today’s ruling is a very strong statement that the entire prosecution is flawed,’ said attorney Adam Frank, who is representing Lucero.

According to Frank, Judge Kirby also said Thursday that if he had been presented with the protesters’ arrest warrants he would not have signed them, signaling the judge did not believe there was probable cause for any of the charges.”

An Adams County judge threw out attempted-kidnapping charges Thursday against three members of the Party for Socialism and Liberation who were arrested for their roles in an Elijah McClain protest last summer outside an Aurora police precinct.

item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: “An Adams County judge threw out attempted-kidnapping charges...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

“An Adams County judge threw out attempted-kidnapping charges Thursday against three members of the Party for Socialism and Liberation who were arrested for their roles leading an Elijah McClain protest last summer outside an Aurora police precinct.

In a rare ruling, Judge Leroy Kirby dismissed the Class 3 felony charges against Lillian House, 26, Whitney Lucero, 23, and Joel Northam, 33, following a preliminary hearing that took place March 9 and 16.

Preliminary hearings are... conducted to determine whether there is probable cause to support serious charges, and the standard prosecutors must meet is lower than at a trial. In most cases, judges find there is sufficient evidence to proceed to trial.

“Today’s ruling is a very strong statement that the entire prosecution is flawed,” said attorney Adam Frank, who is representing Lucero.

According to Frank, Judge Kirby also said Thursday that if he had been presented with the protesters’ arrest warrants he would not have signed them, signaling the judge did not believe there was probable cause for any of the charges.”

See MoreAn Adams County judge threw out attempted-kidnapping charges Thursday against three members of the Party for Socialism and Liberation who were arrested for their roles in an Elijah McClain protest …

denverpost.com

Judge throws out attempted-kidnapping charges against Aurora protest leaders

BreakThrough News

The only people charged over the brutal police murder of Elijah McClain are community activists who organized mass peaceful demonstrations calling for justice. ...They are facing up to 48 years in prison - among the highest charges for peaceful political protest in recent history.
